articles.headline: Biden Inaugurated as the 46th President Amid a Cascade of Crises
articles.snippet: Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. and Kamala Devi Harris took the oath of office at a Capitol still reeling from the attack of a violent mob at a time when a deadly pandemic is still ravaging the country.
articles.abstract: Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. and Kamala Devi Harris took the oath of office at a Capitol still reeling from the attack of a violent mob at a time when a deadly pandemic is still ravaging the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. was sworn in on Wednesday as the 46th president of the United States, assuming leadership of a country ravaged by disease, dislocation and division with a call to “end this uncivil war” after four tumultuous years that tore at the fabric of American society.

articles.headline: How Joe Biden Became a Steady Hand Amid So Much Chaos
articles.snippet: In recent months, Mr. Biden’s restraint with words and his refusal to take the political bait laid by President Trump show a level of discipline as the 46th president faces a cascade of crises.
articles.abstract: In recent months, Mr. Biden’s restraint with words and his refusal to take the political bait laid by President Trump show a level of discipline as the 46th president faces a cascade of crises.
articles.lead_paragraph: As a child, Joseph Robinette Biden Jr. wrestled with words, grappling with a boyhood stutter. Years later, as a young politician, he couldn’t stop saying them, quickly developing a reputation for long-winded remarks.

articles.headline: From Trump to Biden, TV Captures a Dramatic Shift
articles.snippet: The new president’s speech on unity — “the best inaugural address I ever heard,” says Chris Wallace of Fox News — follows Donald Trump’s “My Way” moment.
articles.abstract: The new president’s speech on unity — “the best inaugural address I ever heard,” says Chris Wallace of Fox News — follows Donald Trump’s “My Way” moment.
articles.lead_paragraph: For a moment, cable news found something to agree on.
articles.byline: By John Koblin and Michael M. Grynbaum

articles.headline: A Call for Unity to a Nation Facing a Pandemic and Division
articles.snippet: In his Inaugural Address, President Biden spoke of a return to the ordinary discord of democracy, with a reminder that “politics doesn’t have to be a raging fire, destroying everything in its path.”
articles.abstract: In his Inaugural Address, President Biden spoke of a return to the ordinary discord of democracy, with a reminder that “politics doesn’t have to be a raging fire, destroying everything in its path.”
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the end, the inauguration triumphed over the insurrection.

articles.headline: Washington Breathes an Uneasy Sigh of Relief
articles.snippet: Whether or not related to the absence of former President Donald J. Trump, a bipartisan lightness seemed to prevail across the inaugural stage.
articles.abstract: Whether or not related to the absence of former President Donald J. Trump, a bipartisan lightness seemed to prevail across the inaugural stage.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Quite a difference between two chilly Wednesdays in January: Under a crystalline Inauguration Day sky and a bunting-draped Capitol, the Marine Band welcomed the 46th president into office with a procession of fanfares — in the same spot that a mob answering the call of the 45th had ransacked the building two weeks earlier to try to stop this transfer of power.

articles.headline: How the American Unemployment System Failed
articles.snippet: A decline in funding and changes in the workplace — and how long people are out of work — have left a program unequal to the 21st-century economy.
articles.abstract: A decline in funding and changes in the workplace — and how long people are out of work — have left a program unequal to the 21st-century economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s unemployment insurance program, conceived during the Great Depression, was meant to keep jobless workers and their families from suffering drops in income that could tip them into poverty or force them to liquidate their assets to afford food, rent and other necessities.
articles.byline: By Eduardo Porter and Karl Russell

articles.headline: Biden Unveils National Strategy That Trump Resisted
articles.snippet: President Biden has a 200-page strategy to bolster production of vaccines, treatments and medical-grade protective gear while reaching out to communities of color.
articles.abstract: President Biden has a 200-page strategy to bolster production of vaccines, treatments and medical-grade protective gear while reaching out to communities of color.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Biden, seeking to assert leadership over the coronavirus pandemic, signed a string of executive orders and presidential directives on Thursday aimed at creating the kind of centralized authority that the Trump administration had shied away from.

articles.headline: Charlottesville Inspired Biden to Run. Now It Has a Message for Him.
articles.snippet: The white supremacist rally in 2017 prefigured the rise of right-wing violence in President Trump’s name. Now, as President Biden calls for national unity, residents say it requires accountability first.
articles.abstract: The white supremacist rally in 2017 prefigured the rise of right-wing violence in President Trump’s name. Now, as President Biden calls for national unity, residents say it requires accountability first.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va. — Susan Bro recognized the palpable anger and open bigotry on display in the mob that attacked the United States Capitol this month. It reminded her of the outpouring of hate that killed her daughter, Heather Heyer.

articles.headline: Continuing Job Losses Put Spotlight on Economic Relief
articles.snippet: Relentless unemployment claims show the pandemic’s grip on the labor market. Help from the recent stimulus bill may lapse before an upturn arrives.
articles.abstract: Relentless unemployment claims show the pandemic’s grip on the labor market. Help from the recent stimulus bill may lapse before an upturn arrives.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even as it tries to right a shipwrecked economy, the Biden administration confronted fresh evidence of weakness Thursday with the report of nearly a million new state unemployment claims, heightening calls for fresh stimulus efforts.
